project.description: The Deploy job is used to deploy a working application onto a target environment. This job is typically run after the Target Environment job. In order to use this job for deploying an application, enter in the same value you used for the "STACK_NAME" when running the Target Environment job into the "STACK_NAME" parameter in this job. Jenkins will do the rest!

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
if [ $deployToProduction == true ] then STAGE=production else STAGE=development fi
cd ${WORKSPACE}/deployment/ cap setup stack=${STACK_NAME} key=/usr/share/tomcat6/.ssh/id_rsa language=rails stage=${STAGE}
host=`ruby ${WORKSPACE}/lib/showback_domain.rb --item ${STACK_NAME} \ --key InstanceIPAddress`
cucumber ${WORKSPACE}/deployment/features/deployment.feature host=${host} user=ec2-user key=/usr/share/tomcat6/.ssh/id_rsa
sns-publish --topic-arn $SNS_TOPIC \ --subject "Application Deployed" \ --message "Your Application has been deployed successfully. You can view it by going to http://$host/ This instance was deployed to by $JENKINS_DOMAIN" --aws-credential-file /usr/share/tomcat6/aws_access
